Package org.neo4j.scheduler

Interface JobScheduler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Lifecycle
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CallingThreadJobScheduler, CentralJobScheduler, JobSchedulerAdapter, OnDemandJobScheduler, ThreadPoolJobScheduler
    public interface JobScheduler
extends Lifecycle, AutoCloseable
    To be expanded, the idea here is to have a database-global service for running jobs, handling jobs crashing and so on.

    • Method Detail

      • setTopLevelGroupName

        void setTopLevelGroupName​(String name)
        Assign a specific name to the top-most scheduler group.

        This is just a suggestion for debugging purpose. The specific scheduler implementation is free to ignore calls to this method.

      • setParallelism

        void setParallelism​(Group group,
                    int parallelism)
        Set the desired parallelism for the given group. This only has an effect if the underlying scheduler for the given group has not already been started, and a desired parallelism has not already been set.
        Parameters:
        group - The group to set the desired parallelism for.
        parallelism - The desired number of threads in the thread pool for the given group.

      • setThreadFactory

        void setThreadFactory​(Group group,
                      SchedulerThreadFactoryFactory threadFactory)
        Assign a SchedulerThreadFactory to a given group. This only has an effect if the underlying scheduler for the given group has not already been started.
        Parameters:
        group - The group to assign the given thread factory for.
        threadFactory - The thread factory to assign.

      • executor

        CallableExecutor executor​(Group group)
        Expose a group scheduler as an Executor.

        NOTE: The returned instance might be an implementation of the ExecutorService interface. If so, then it is NOT allowed to shut it down, because the life cycle of the executor is managed by the JobScheduler.

      • monitoredJobExecutor

        MonitoredJobExecutor monitoredJobExecutor​(Group group)
        Expose a group scheduler as a MonitoredJobExecutor.

      • threadFactory

        ThreadFactory threadFactory​(Group group)
        Expose a group scheduler as a ThreadFactory. This is a lower-level alternative than executor(Group), where you are in control of when to spin up new threads for your jobs.

        The lifecycle of the threads you get out of here are not managed by the JobScheduler, you own the lifecycle and must start the thread before it can be used.

        This mechanism is strongly preferred over manually creating threads, as it allows a central place for record keeping of thread creation, central place for customizing the threads based on their groups, and lays a foundation for controlling things like thread affinity and priorities in a coordinated manner in the future.

      • profileGroup

        void profileGroup​(Group group,
                  Profiler profiler)
        Initiate profiling of all threads within the given group, using the given profiler.
        Parameters:
        group - the group with all the threads to profile.
        profiler - the profiler to use.

      • getMonitoredJobs

        List<MonitoredJobInfo> getMonitoredJobs()
